text:
A Right to Crime?

Dimly lit room, tense atmosphere  
Raskolnikov smirks at the challenge.  
Razumihin: “How did you find out?”  

---

Same room, Razumihin looks alarmed  
Porfiry: “You suggested a right to crime!”  
Raskolnikov: “A distortion of my idea.”  

---

Same room, Raskolnikov leans in, intrigued  
Porfiry: “Ordinary men must obey the law.”  
Porfiry: “Extraordinary men can break it!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The conversation revolves around the distinction between "ordinary" and "extraordinary" individuals regarding their moral and legal rights to commit crimes.
